Date: January 06, 2025

The State Bank of India has introduced the 'SBI Patrons' scheme catering specifically to Super Senior Citizens aged 80 and above, offering higher interest rates on term deposits.

  • The new scheme, 'SBI Patrons', is geared toward both new and existing customers.
  • Super Senior Citizens are defined as individuals aged 80 years or older.

Date: January 06, 2025
Source: Moneycontrol

India’s second-largest IT services company, Infosys, has decided to postpone its annual salary hikes until the fourth quarter of FY25 due to ongoing global market challenges.

  • Salary increments, typically implemented earlier in the year, will now be staggered; some will take effect in January 2025, with others in April 2025.
  • Other major IT firms have also deferred pay raises as a response to weakened client budgets and macroeconomic pressures.
  • Infosys reported a 2.2% sequential net profit increase, reaching Rs 6,506 crore, despite missing market expectations.
  • The company's margins improved slightly, supported by better operational efficiencies and lower onsite costs.
  • Selective increments are still being offered to high-performing employees in specialized fields like AI.
“In today’s uncertain economic environment, holding on to a job itself is being viewed by many as a significant advantage.”

Despite the delay in pay hikes, some analysts believe that Infosys' margin pressures may ease thanks to strategic cost-management initiatives.

title: SEBI relaxes norms for settling client accounts inactive for 30 days - The Economic Times
summary:
SEBI Eases Rules for Settling Inactive Client Accounts

Publication Date: January 6, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has relaxed norms regarding the settlement of accounts by brokerages for clients who have not traded in over 30 days. This aims to improve efficiency and facilitate business.

  • The revised rules allow settlements for clients who trade again after 30 days and before the next monthly settlement cycle.
  • This change comes following concerns raised by the Brokers’ Industry Standards Forum regarding procedural inefficiencies.
  • Settlements are now to be aligned with the annual calendar of settlements notified by exchanges.
  • The new provisions take effect immediately.
"It has been decided to revise the requirement of mandatory settlement of such clients’ funds." - SEBI circular

This regulatory change is expected to streamline processes and enhance the ease of doing business for brokerages while safeguarding investor interests.
newTitle: SEBI Eases Rules for Settling Inactive Client Accounts

title: Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT route - Business Standard

Publication Date: Monday

Source: Nirma Group Announcement

Nuvoco Vistas Corp, a company promoted by the Nirma Group, has emerged as the successful applicant for Vadraj Cement in a corporate insolvency resolution process (CIRP).

  • The transaction will increase Nuvoco's cement capacity from 25 MTPA to approximately 31 MTPA, a 20% increase.
  • The resolution plan submitted by Nuvoco has been approved by the committee of creditors.
  • Nuvoco plans a phased investment over 15 months for refurbishment of assets and operational improvements.
  • Production is expected to commence around Q3 of FY27, pending approvals.
  • Vadraj Cement is currently undergoing insolvency with admitted claims of Rs 8,180.61 crore.
“Overall investment, including refurbishment of assets, will be more cost-effective than greenfield or brownfield expansions.”

This acquisition reinforces Nuvoco's position as the fifth largest cement manufacturer in India.
newTitle: Nirma Group's Nuvoco Vistas Corp to Acquire Vadraj Cement via NCLT Route
